title: How to Make Danish Pancakes

steps.headline: Beat egg white until stiff; set aside.
Beat egg yolks in another bowl until thick and lemon-colored, add flour and mix well.
steps.description: Add beer, milk, salt and butter and beat until smooth. Carefully fold in egg whites. Don't use too much beer. If preferred, you can even leave it out.

steps.headline: Pour a little batter in 6-inch greased skillet.
steps.description: Rotate skillet to spread batter over surface.

steps.headline: Cook until brown on both sides.
steps.description: Repeat until all batter is used.

steps.headline: Serve hot with strawberry jam.
Grease the aebleskiver pan lightly.
steps.description: The pan should be preheated before adding the batter, so place on the stove at a medium heat to warm.

steps.headline: Add the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt to a medium size mixing bowl.
steps.description: Stir to mix together.

steps.headline: Crack the egg into a separate bowl.
steps.description: Add the milk, vanilla extract and vegetable oil. Whisk quickly to break the yolk and combine the ingredients.

steps.headline: Pour the egg mixture into the dry ingredients bowl.
steps.description: Whisk quickly to combine the ingredients, moistening everything. Do not over mix; leave the batter lumpy.

steps.headline: Pour the batter into the pre-heated aebleskiver holes.
steps.description: Fill about halfway.

steps.headline: Cook on medium heat for 1 minute, or until lightly browned.
steps.description: If you want to place something in the middle of the pancakes, such as bits of meat, jam, pieces of fruit, etc., do it at this point so that the items sink into the middle of the pancake before flipping over.

steps.headline: Flip over the pancakes using a fork, tongs, bamboo skewer, chopstick, etc, to cook the uncooked side.
steps.description: Cook again for another minute until the other side is browned.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat.
steps.description: Tip the pancakes out onto plates.

steps.headline: Serve immediately.
steps.description: These can be served as they are or you can accompany them with jam, cream, fresh fruit, syrup, dusted with confectioners/icing sugar, etc.

steps.headline: Prepare the aebleskiver pan.
steps.description: Grease each of the holes. The pan should be preheated before adding the batter, so place on the stove to heat on medium heat.

steps.headline: Whisk the egg yolks and 1 tablespoon of sugar.
steps.description: Whisk until the sugar has dissolved.

steps.headline: Pour in the vegetable oil and buttermilk.
steps.description: Mix to combine well.

steps.headline: Whisk in the salt, baking powder and flour.
steps.description: When the batter is smooth and has few lumps, stop whisking.

steps.headline: In another bowl, beat the egg whites with 1 tablespoon of sugar.
steps.description: Beat until soft peaks form.

steps.headline: Fold the egg white mixture into the flour mixture.
Tip the batter into the pre-warmed aebleskiver holes.
steps.description: Fill each one about 3/4 to the top.

steps.headline: Cook the pancakes.
steps.description: When the butter begins to bubble and the base has turned golden, flip the pancakes over. Use a fork, skewer, tongs, etc. to do this.

steps.headline: Cook the other side until the whole pancake turns golden brown.
Transfer to the warmed serving plates.
Serve.
steps.description: The pancakes can be dusted with confectioners or icing sugar, or served with jam, cream, berries/fruit, etc.

steps.headline: Prepare the aebleskiver pan.
steps.description: Grease each of the holes with 1/2 teaspoon oil each. The pan should be preheated before adding the batter, so place on the stove to heat on medium heat.

steps.headline: Make the vegan buttermilk.
steps.description: Mix together the plant-based milk and the lemon juice. Set aside to curdle.

steps.headline: Whisk the dry ingredients together in a large mixing bowl.
steps.description: This includes the egg replacer powder. It will be activated by the addition of liquid shortly.

steps.headline: Pour in the wet ingredients.
steps.description: Stir briefly to moisten all ingredients; do not over mix.

steps.headline: Pour the batter into the pre-warmed aebelskiver pan.
steps.description: Pour in about 2 tablespoons per hole.

steps.headline: Cook for 30 seconds to a minute, or until golden brown.
Flip over the cook the other side for about the same time.
steps.description: Use a fork, tongs, etc. to flip over the pancakes.

steps.headline: Turn again onto the sides to cook, if needed.
steps.description: The whole pancake should be cooked to golden brown on all sides.

steps.headline: Transfer to warm serving plates.
steps.description: If making more, add new oil to each hole in the cooking pan.

steps.headline: Serve immediately.
steps.description: These can be sprinkled with confectioners/icing sugar, served with jam, vegan cream or fresh berries/fruits.

text: Beer flat pancakes Beat egg white until stiff; set aside.  Beat egg yolks in another bowl until thick and lemon-colored, add flour and mix well. Add beer, milk, salt and butter and beat until smooth. Carefully fold in egg whites. Don't use too much beer. If preferred, you can even leave it out. Pour a little batter in 6-inch greased skillet. Rotate skillet to spread batter over surface. Cook until brown on both sides. Repeat until all batter is used. Serve hot with strawberry jam.  Aebleskivers Danish pancakes Grease the aebleskiver pan lightly. The pan should be preheated before adding the batter, so place on the stove at a medium heat to warm. Add the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt to a medium size mixing bowl. Stir to mix together. Crack the egg into a separate bowl. Add the milk, vanilla extract and vegetable oil. Whisk quickly to break the yolk and combine the ingredients. Pour the egg mixture into the dry ingredients bowl. Whisk quickly to combine the ingredients, moistening everything. Do not over mix; leave the batter lumpy. Pour the batter into the pre-heated aebleskiver holes. Fill about halfway. Cook on medium heat for 1 minute, or until lightly browned. If you want to place something in the middle of the pancakes, such as bits of meat, jam, pieces of fruit, etc., do it at this point so that the items sink into the middle of the pancake before flipping over. Flip over the pancakes using a fork, tongs, bamboo skewer, chopstick, etc, to cook the uncooked side. Cook again for another minute until the other side is browned. Remove from the heat. Tip the pancakes out onto plates. Serve immediately. These can be served as they are or you can accompany them with jam, cream, fresh fruit, syrup, dusted with confectioners/icing sugar, etc. Buttermilk aebleskiver Danish pancakes Prepare the aebleskiver pan. Grease each of the holes. The pan should be preheated before adding the batter, so place on the stove to heat on medium heat. Whisk the egg yolks and 1 tablespoon of sugar. Whisk until the sugar has dissolved. Pour in the vegetable oil and buttermilk. Mix to combine well. Whisk in the salt, baking powder and flour. When the batter is smooth and has few lumps, stop whisking. In another bowl, beat the egg whites with 1 tablespoon of sugar. Beat until soft peaks form. Fold the egg white mixture into the flour mixture.  Tip the batter into the pre-warmed aebleskiver holes. Fill each one about 3/4 to the top. Cook the pancakes. When the butter begins to bubble and the base has turned golden, flip the pancakes over. Use a fork, skewer, tongs, etc. to do this. Cook the other side until the whole pancake turns golden brown.  Transfer to the warmed serving plates.  Serve. The pancakes can be dusted with confectioners or icing sugar, or served with jam, cream, berries/fruit, etc. Vegan aebleskiver Danish pancakes Prepare the aebleskiver pan. Grease each of the holes with 1/2 teaspoon oil each. The pan should be preheated before adding the batter, so place on the stove to heat on medium heat. Make the vegan buttermilk. Mix together the plant-based milk and the lemon juice. Set aside to curdle. Whisk the dry ingredients together in a large mixing bowl. This includes the egg replacer powder. It will be activated by the addition of liquid shortly. Pour in the wet ingredients. Stir briefly to moisten all ingredients; do not over mix. Pour the batter into the pre-warmed aebelskiver pan. Pour in about 2 tablespoons per hole. Cook for 30 seconds to a minute, or until golden brown.  Flip over the cook the other side for about the same time. Use a fork, tongs, etc. to flip over the pancakes. Turn again onto the sides to cook, if needed. The whole pancake should be cooked to golden brown on all sides. Transfer to warm serving plates. If making more, add new oil to each hole in the cooking pan. Serve immediately. These can be sprinkled with confectioners/icing sugar, served with jam, vegan cream or fresh berries/fruits.
